Legal_Issue: Can the trademark registration be maintained despite non-use due to special circumstances?
Evidence_Assessment: Appellant conceded non-use for 29 months and provided insufficient evidence of special circumstances or intent to resume use
Decision_Outcome: Registrar's decision to expunge the trademark is upheld
Burden_of_Proof: On appellant to show use or special circumstances justifying non-use
Legal_Rule: Under Canadian Trademarks Act, s. 45 requires evidence of use or special circumstances justifying non-use
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-use of trademark for nearly two years without sufficient justification
Key_Evidence_Considered: Concession of non-use for 29 months, lack of evidence of special circumstances or intent to resume use
Applicant_Challenge: Maintaining trademark registration despite prolonged non-use
Decision_Authority: Registrar of Trademarks, affirmed by court
Remedy_Sought: Prevention of expungement of trademark registration
Legal_Provision: s. 45 of the Canadian Trademarks Act
Authority: Registrar of Trademarks, Court on appeal
Applicable_Process: Summary expungement under s. 45 followed by appeal
